theory: Sabo's survival was foreshadowed by Dragon's presence at Gray Terminal. Many fans theorized that when Dragon witnessed the Celestial Dragon shoot down Sabo's ship in Episode 503, he would rescue the boy. This theory was supported by Dragon appearing at Gray Terminal the same night carrying an unknown injured person. The lack of showing Sabo's body and only his hat floating reinforced the belief he survived.
author: One Piece Fandom (collective fan theory)
confirmationDetails: Sabo was revealed to be alive and working with the Revolutionary Army, having been rescued by Dragon and suffering amnesia from his injuries. This confirmed the long-standing fan theory about his survival.

theory: The nobles' plan to burn Gray Terminal represents Oda's social commentary on how governments and upper classes historically 'clean up' poverty by hiding or eliminating the poor rather than addressing systemic issues. Fans theorized this was inspired by real-world instances of cities forcibly removing homeless populations or slums before major events or visits from dignitaries.
author: One Piece Analysis Community
confirmationDetails: This theory is an interpretation of Oda's thematic messaging rather than a plot prediction. The Goa Kingdom's actions parallel real-world social issues, which Oda has confirmed through interviews is intentional social commentary in his work.

theory: Sterry's casual revelation of the genocide plot and his eventual rise to become King of Goa Kingdom demonstrates a pattern in One Piece where morally bankrupt characters rise to power through complicity with systemic evil. Fans theorized after his introduction that Sterry would eventually hold a position of significant authority, which was confirmed when he became king.
author: One Piece Fandom
confirmationDetails: Sterry became King of Goa Kingdom after the suspicious deaths of the previous king and prince, confirming fan theories that his morally corrupt nature and ambition would lead to him gaining power.

theory: Sabo's character arc and revolutionary ideals were seeded in Episode 500 when he discovered the nobles' willingness to commit genocide for appearances. Fans theorized that if Sabo survived, he would become involved with revolutionary activities against the World Government due to this traumatic experience with noble corruption.
author: One Piece Fandom
confirmationDetails: Sabo was revealed to be the Chief of Staff of the Revolutionary Army, the number 2 position under Dragon. His revolutionary ideals and hatred of nobility directly stem from the events shown in Episodes 500-503, confirming fan predictions about his character trajectory.
